decks.notes: The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The control aspect comes from cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return to disrupt opponent's strategies and clear the board. Sowing Mycospawn provides additional token creatures for defense or offense. The deck also utilizes cards like Kozilek's Command and Devourer of Destiny to maintain card advantage and control the game. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly ramping into big threats while controlling the board.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes a combination of mana fixing lands, powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and removal spells like Lightning Bolt to control the board and maintain pressure. The deck also includes Leyline cards to provide additional benefits and protection. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to swarm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while disrupting their game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game with powerful Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells while utilizing the UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator, while also having access to versatile removal options such as Dismember and All Is Dust. The deck can generate significant card advantage with cards like Mind Stone and Relic of Progenitus, ultimately aiming to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and efficient removal spells.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast-paced aggression and a mix of creature and spell-based damage. It focuses on using creatures like Seasoned Pyromancer, Ragavan, and Pheline to put pressure on the opponent while utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for additional damage. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory for buffing and protection, along with disruption elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm. Overall, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and close out the game efficiently.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly consistently damaging the opponent with cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also includes ways to manipulate the top of the library with Expressive Iteration and Preordain to ensure draws are impactful. Mutagenic Growth and Slickshot Show-Off provide additional pump and removal options, while Violent Urge can push through blockers. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and close out games swiftly.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing a variety of land and mana sources, it can cast a wide range of powerful threats early in the game. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells and protection spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own threats. The key strategy is to maintain a strong board presence while keeping pressure on the opponent, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of direct damage and efficient creatures.

This deck revolves around utilizing Allosaurus Rider as a powerful combo piece, allowing you to quickly ramp into big threats like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. The deck utilizes various tutor effects like Eldritch Evolution and Summoner's Pact to search for key combo pieces, while also including cards like Neoform and Consign to Memory to further enhance its combo potential. The inclusion of cards like Xenagos, God of Revels and Planar Genesis provide additional synergy and power to overwhelm your opponent in a swift and explosive manner.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also has solid removal options with cards like Thraben Charm and Static Prison. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional support and card advantage. Elegant Parlor and Arena of Glory help to control the board and maintain tempo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mix of creatures and burn spells, while also having some protection against control decks.

The deck is focused on utilizing a powerful combo with cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom to quickly win the game. It aims to disrupt opponents with a mix of countermagic, removal, and disruptive spells while also controlling the game with cards like Tameshi, Reality Architect and Hydroelectric Specimen. By using these tools effectively, the deck can achieve a powerful win condition without relying on traditional land drops. It seeks to overwhelm opponents with its unique approach to combo and disruption in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on playing creatures with cycling abilities to quickly cycle through the deck and then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. The key strategy is to manipulate the graveyard and use cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation to protect the combo. By cycling through the deck and filling up the graveyard, the deck can set up powerful creature reanimation plays to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden board presence. The deck also includes counterspells and disruptive cards to control the game and protect the combo.

The deck is focused on creating a fast and aggressive gameplay style, utilizing a combination of creatures and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, while supporting them with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks. Cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Voice of Victory provide utility and additional support, making it difficult for the opponent to effectively defend against the aggressive onslaught.

The deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, Power Plant) to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells. By controlling the board with removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command, as well as Karn, the Great Creator, players can disrupt their opponent's strategy while building their own. With Ugin, the Eye of the Storms providing additional removal and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats like Devourer of Destiny and Sire of Seven Deaths.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Atraxa's ability. It also utilizes instant spells like Ephemerate and Solitude to control the board and protect your combo pieces. The deck includes a variety of lands to ensure mana consistency and has cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt your opponent's strategy. The goal is to quickly bring out your big threats and overwhelm your opponent before they can react, making for explosive gameplay and unexpected plays.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. By combining efficient removal spells like Fatal Push with disruptive creatures like Recruiter of the Guard and Flickerwisp, the deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options. With cards like Ephemerate and Solitude providing additional protection and value, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its aggressive threats. The mana base includes a mix of black and white sources to support the deck's powerful creatures and disruption spells.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the pieces needed to generate a large amount of mana, using cards like Ruby Medallion and Desperate Ritual to cast spells for free or at a reduced cost. Ral, Monsoon Mage is used to draw cards and provide added value to the spells being cast. Once enough mana is generated, the deck can use cards like Past in Flames to recast spells from the graveyard and eventually win the game through a large Grapeshot or similar spell. The deck aims to combo off in the early turns and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

This deck focuses on assembling a quick combo using cards like Tameshi, Reality Architect and Hydroelectric Specimen to generate mana and power up Goblin Charbelcher for a lethal finish. The deck aims to disrupt opponent's strategies with counterspells like Force of Negation and Pact of Negation while controlling the board with cards like Sink into Stupor and Suppression Ray. Whir of Invention helps tutor for key pieces while Jwari Disruption provides additional disruption. The deck is fast-paced and relies on intricate sequencing and calculated risks to surprise opponents and win the game.
